com.sponsorpay.sdk.android.publisher
Class SponsorPayPublisher

java.lang.Object
  com.sponsorpay.sdk.android.publisher.SponsorPayPublisher

public class SponsorPayPublisher
extends java.lang.Object

Provides convenience calls to load and show the mobile Offer Wall and the mobile Interstitial.

getIntentForOfferWallActivity

public static android.content.Intent getIntentForOfferWallActivity(android.content.Context context,
                                                                   java.lang.Boolean shouldStayOpen)

Returns an Intent that can be used to launch the OfferWallActivity. Lets the caller specify the behavior of the Offer Wall once the user gets redirected out of the application by clicking on an offer.

Will use the publisher application id and user id stored in the current credentials.

Parameters:
context - The publisher application context.
shouldStayOpen - True if the Offer Wall should stay open after the user clicks on an offer and gets redirected out of the app. False to close the Offer Wall.
Returns:
An Android Intent which can be used with the Activity method startActivityForResult() to launch the OfferWallActivity.

getIntentForOfferWallActivity

public static android.content.Intent getIntentForOfferWallActivity(android.content.Context context,
                                                                   java.lang.Boolean shouldStayOpen,
                                                                   java.lang.String currencyName,
                                                                   java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customParams)

Returns an Intent that can be used to launch the OfferWallActivity. Lets the caller specify the behavior of the Offer Wall once the user gets redirected out of the application by clicking on an offer.

Will use the publisher application id and user id stored in the current credentials.

Parameters:
context - The publisher application context.
shouldStayOpen - True if the Offer Wall should stay open after the user clicks on an offer and gets redirected out of the app. False to close the Offer Wall.
currencyName - The name of the currency employed by your application. Provide null if you don't use a custom currency name.
customParams - A map of extra key/value pairs to add to the request URL.
Returns:
An Android Intent which can be used with the Activity method startActivityForResult() to launch the OfferWallActivity.

getIntentForOfferWallActivity

public static android.content.Intent getIntentForOfferWallActivity(java.lang.String credentialsToken,
                                                                   android.content.Context context,
                                                                   java.lang.Boolean shouldStayOpen,
                                                                   java.lang.String currencyName,
                                                                   java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customParams)

Returns an Intent that can be used to launch the OfferWallActivity. Lets the caller specify the behavior of the Offer Wall once the user gets redirected out of the application by clicking on an offer.

Will use the provided publisher application id and user id stored in the credentials identified by the token id.

Parameters:
credentialsToken - The token id of the credentials to be used.
context - The publisher application context.
shouldStayOpen - True if the Offer Wall should stay open after the user clicks on an offer and gets redirected out of the app. False to close the Offer Wall.
currencyName - The name of the currency employed by your application. Provide null if you don't use a custom currency name.
customParams - A map of extra key/value pairs to add to the request URL.
Returns:
An Android Intent which can be used with the Activity method startActivityForResult() to launch the OfferWallActivity.

getIntentForUnlockOfferWallActivity

public static android.content.Intent getIntentForUnlockOfferWallActivity(android.content.Context context,
                                                                         java.lang.String unlockItemId,
                                                                         java.lang.String unlockItemName)

Returns an Intent that can be used to launch the Unlock OfferWallActivity. Let the caller specify the behavior of the Offer Wall once the user gets redirected out of the application by clicking on an offer.

Will use the current credentials or throw an exception if none exists yet.

Parameters:
context - The publisher application context.
unlockItemId - The Id of the item to be used to show offer for unlocking.
unlockItemName - An item name to override the default one set on the server
Returns:
An Android Intent which can be used with the Activity method startActivityForResult() to launch the OfferWallActivity.

getIntentForUnlockOfferWallActivity

public static android.content.Intent getIntentForUnlockOfferWallActivity(java.lang.String credentialsToken,
                                                                         android.content.Context context,
                                                                         java.lang.String unlockItemId,
                                                                         java.lang.String unlockItemName,
                                                                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customParams)

Returns an Intent that can be used to launch the Unlock OfferWallActivity. Let the caller specify the behavior of the Offer Wall once the user gets redirected out of the application by clicking on an offer.

Parameters:
credentialsToken - the id of the credentials hat will be used
context - The publisher application context.
unlockItemId - The Id of the item to be used to show offer for unlocking.
unlockItemName - An item name to override the default one set on the server
customParams - A map of extra key/value pairs to add to the request URL.
Returns:
An Android Intent which can be used with the Activity method startActivityForResult() to launch the OfferWallActivity.

loadShowInterstitial

public static void loadShowInterstitial(android.app.Activity callingActivity,
                                        InterstitialLoader.InterstitialLoadingStatusListener loadingStatusListener,
                                        java.lang.Boolean shouldStayOpen)
Starts the mobile interstitial request / loading / showing process using the current credentials.

Parameters:
callingActivity - The activity which requests the interstitial. A progress dialog will be shown on top of it and if an ad is returned, the calling activity will be used to launch the InterstitialActivity in order to show the ad.
loadingStatusListener - InterstitialLoader.InterstitialLoadingStatusListener to register to be notified of events in the interstitial lifecycle.
shouldStayOpen - Used to specify the behavior of the interstitial once the user clicks on the presented ad and is redirected outside the host publisher app. The default behavior is to close the interstitial and let the user go back to the activity that called the interstitial when they come back to the app. If you want the interstitial not to close until the user does it explicitly, set this parameter to true.

loadShowInterstitial

public static void loadShowInterstitial(android.app.Activity callingActivity,
                                        InterstitialLoader.InterstitialLoadingStatusListener loadingStatusListener,
                                        java.lang.Boolean shouldStayOpen,
                                        java.lang.String backgroundUrl,
                                        java.lang.String skinName,
                                        int loadingTimeoutSecs,
                                        java.lang.String currencyName,
                                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customParams)
Starts the mobile interstitial request / loading / showing process using the current credentials.

Parameters:
callingActivity - The activity which requests the interstitial. A progress dialog will be shown on top of it and if an ad is returned, the calling activity will be used to launch the InterstitialActivity in order to show the ad.
loadingStatusListener - InterstitialLoader.InterstitialLoadingStatusListener to register to be notified of events in the interstitial lifecycle.
shouldStayOpen - Used to specify the behavior of the interstitial once the user clicks on the presented ad and is redirected outside the host publisher app. The default behavior is to close the interstitial and let the user go back to the activity that called the interstitial when they come back to the app. If you want the interstitial not to close until the user does it explicitly, set this parameter to true.
backgroundUrl - Can be set to the absolute URL of an image to use as background graphic for the interstitial. Must include the protocol scheme (http:// or https://) at the beginning of the URL. Leave it null for no custom background.
skinName - Used to specify the name of a custom skin or template for the requested interstitial. Leaving it null will make the interstitial fall back to the DEFAULT template.
loadingTimeoutSecs - Sets the maximum amount of time the interstitial should take to load. If you set it to 0 or a negative number, it will fall back to the default value of 5 seconds.
currencyName - The name of the currency employed by your application. Provide null if you don't use a custom currency name.
customParams - A map of extra key/value pairs to add to the request URL.

loadShowInterstitial

public static void loadShowInterstitial(java.lang.String credentialsToken,
                                        android.app.Activity callingActivity,
                                        InterstitialLoader.InterstitialLoadingStatusListener loadingStatusListener,
                                        java.lang.Boolean shouldStayOpen,
                                        java.lang.String backgroundUrl,
                                        java.lang.String skinName,
                                        int loadingTimeoutSecs,
                                        java.lang.String currencyName,
                                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customParams)
Starts the mobile interstitial request / loading / showing process.

Parameters:
credentialsToken - The token id of the credentials to be used.
callingActivity - The activity which requests the interstitial. A progress dialog will be shown on top of it and if an ad is returned, the calling activity will be used to launch the InterstitialActivity in order to show the ad.
loadingStatusListener - InterstitialLoader.InterstitialLoadingStatusListener to register to be notified of events in the interstitial lifecycle.
shouldStayOpen - Used to specify the behavior of the interstitial once the user clicks on the presented ad and is redirected outside the host publisher app. The default behavior is to close the interstitial and let the user go back to the activity that called the interstitial when they come back to the app. If you want the interstitial not to close until the user does it explicitly, set this parameter to true.
backgroundUrl - Can be set to the absolute URL of an image to use as background graphic for the interstitial. Must include the protocol scheme (http:// or https://) at the beginning of the URL. Leave it null for no custom background.
skinName - Used to specify the name of a custom skin or template for the requested interstitial. Leaving it null will make the interstitial fall back to the DEFAULT template.
loadingTimeoutSecs - Sets the maximum amount of time the interstitial should take to load. If you set it to 0 or a negative number, it will fall back to the default value of 5 seconds.
currencyName - The name of the currency employed by your application. Provide null if you don't use a custom currency name.
customParams - A map of extra key/value pairs to add to the request URL.

requestNewCoins

public static void requestNewCoins(android.content.Context context,
                                   SPCurrencyServerListener listener)
Sends a request to the SponsorPay currency server to obtain the variation in amount of virtual currency for a given user. Returns immediately, and the answer is delivered to one of the provided listener's callback methods. See SPCurrencyServerListener. The current credentials will be used to get the application id and user id.

Parameters:
context - Android application context.
listener - SPCurrencyServerListener which will be notified of the result of the request.

requestNewCoins

public static void requestNewCoins(android.content.Context context,
                                   SPCurrencyServerListener listener,
                                   java.lang.String customCurrency)
Sends a request to the SponsorPay currency server to obtain the variation in amount of virtual currency for a given user. Returns immediately, and the answer is delivered to one of the provided listener's callback methods. See SPCurrencyServerListener. The current credentials will be used to get the application id and user id.

Parameters:
context - Android application context.
listener - SPCurrencyServerListener which will be notified of the result of the request.
customCurrency - A string representing the custom currency to be used by the toast message to show the amount of coins earned.

requestNewCoins

public static void requestNewCoins(java.lang.String credentialsToken,
                                   android.content.Context context,
                                   SPCurrencyServerListener listener,
                                   java.lang.String transactionId,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customParams,
                                   java.lang.String customCurrency)
Sends a request to the SponsorPay currency server to obtain the variation in amount of virtual currency for a given user. Returns immediately, and the answer is delivered to one of the provided listener's callback methods. See SPCurrencyServerListener. It will use the credentials identified by the provided token id.

Parameters:
credentialsToken - The token id of the credentials to be used.
context - Android application context.
listener - SPCurrencyServerListener which will be notified of the result of the request.
transactionId - Optionally, provide the ID of the latest known transaction. The delta of coins will be calculated from this transaction (not included) up to the present. Leave it to null to let the SDK use the latest transaction ID it kept track of.
customParams - A map of extra key/value pairs to add to the request URL.
customCurrency - A string representing the custom currency to be used by the toast message to show the amount of coins earned.

displayNotificationForSuccessfullCoinRequest

public static void displayNotificationForSuccessfullCoinRequest(boolean shouldShowNotification)
Allows the configuration of the Toast notification message that display the amount of coins earned after a successful request to the SponsorPay's Currency server. This is ON by default.

Parameters:
shouldShowNotification - Whether the Toast notification message should be shown or not

requestUnlockItemsStatus

public static void requestUnlockItemsStatus(android.content.Context context,
                                            SPUnlockResponseListener listener)

Requests the status of the "Unlockable" Items to the SponsorPay servers and registers a listener which will be notified when a response is received.

This method will use the current credentials or throw a RuntimeException if there's none.

Parameters:
context - Android application context.
listener - SPUnlockResponseListener which will be notified of the results of the request.

                                                    SPOfferBannerListener listener)

Parameters:
callingActivity - The activity which requests the interstitial. A progress dialog will be shown on top of it and if an ad is returned, the calling activity will be used to launch the InterstitialActivity in order to show the ad.
userId - The current user ID of the host application.
loadingStatusListener - InterstitialLoader.InterstitialLoadingStatusListener to register to be notified of events in the interstitial lifecycle.
shouldStayOpen - Used to specify the behavior of the interstitial once the user clicks on the presented ad and is redirected outside the host publisher app. The default behavior is to close the interstitial and let the user go back to the activity that called the interstitial when they come back to the app. If you want the interstitial not to close until the user does it explicitly, set this parameter to true.
backgroundUrl - Can be set to the absolute URL of an image to use as background graphic for the interstitial. Must include the protocol scheme (http:// or https://) at the beginning of the URL. Leave it null for no custom background.
skinName - Used to specify the name of a custom skin or template for the requested interstitial. Leaving it null will make the interstitial fall back to the DEFAULT template.
loadingTimeoutSecs - Sets the maximum amount of time the interstitial should take to load. If you set it to 0 or a negative number, it will fall back to the default value of 5 seconds.

loadShowInterstitial

                                        InterstitialLoader.InterstitialLoadingStatusListener loadingStatusListener,
                                        java.lang.Boolean shouldStayOpen,
                                        java.lang.String backgroundUrl,
                                        java.lang.String skinName)

Starts the mobile interstitial request / loading / showing process using a default value for loadingTimeoutSecs and retrieving the application id from the Android Manifest.

skinName - Used to specify the name of a custom skin or template for the requested interstitial. Leaving it null will make the interstitial fall back to the DEFAULT template.

requestNewCoins

public static void requestNewCoins(android.content.Context context,
                                   java.lang.String userId,
                                   SPCurrencyServerListener listener,
                                   java.lang.String transactionId,
                                   java.lang.String securityToken,
                                   java.lang.String applicationId)
Deprecated. This method will be removed from a future release of the SDK.

Sends a request to the SponsorPay currency server to obtain the variation in amount of virtual currency for a given user. Returns immediately, and the answer is delivered to one of the provided listener's callback methods. See SPCurrencyServerListener.

Parameters:
context - Android application context.
userId - The ID of the user for which the delta of coins will be requested.
listener - SPCurrencyServerListener which will be notified of the result of the request.
transactionId - Optionally, provide the ID of the latest known transaction. The delta of coins will be calculated from this transaction (not included) up to the present. Leave it to null to let the SDK use the latest transaction ID it kept track of.
securityToken - Security Token associated with the provided Application ID. It's used to sign the requests and verify the server responses.
applicationId - Application ID assigned by SponsorPay. Provide null to read the Application ID from the Application Manifest.

requestNewCoins

public static void requestNewCoins(android.content.Context context,
                                   java.lang.String userId,
                                   SPCurrencyServerListener listener,
                                   java.lang.String transactionId,
                                   java.lang.String securityToken,
                                   java.lang.String applicationId,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customParams)
Deprecated. This method will be removed from a future release of the SDK.

Sends a request to the SponsorPay currency server to obtain the variation in amount of virtual currency for a given user. Returns immediately, and the answer is delivered to one of the provided listener's callback methods. See SPCurrencyServerListener.

Parameters:
context - Android application context.
userId - The ID of the user for which the delta of coins will be requested.
listener - SPCurrencyServerListener which will be notified of the result of the request.
transactionId - Optionally, provide the ID of the latest known transaction. The delta of coins will be calculated from this transaction (not included) up to the present. Leave it to null to let the SDK use the latest transaction ID it kept track of.
securityToken - Security Token associated with the provided Application ID. It's used to sign the requests and verify the server responses.
applicationId - Application ID assigned by SponsorPay. Provide null to read the Application ID from the Application Manifest.
customParams - A map of extra key/value pairs to add to the request URL.

requestUnlockItemsStatus

public static void requestUnlockItemsStatus(android.content.Context context,
                                            java.lang.String userId,
                                            SPUnlockResponseListener listener,
                                            java.lang.String securityToken)
Deprecated. This method will be removed from a future release of the SDK.

Requests the status of the "Unlockable" Items to the SponsorPay servers and registers a listener which will be notified when a response is received.

Will use the application id set in the application manifest.

Parameters:
context - Android application context.
userId - The ID of the user for whom the banner will be requested.
listener - SPUnlockResponseListener which will be notified of the results of the request.
securityToken - Security Token associated with the provided Application ID. It's used to sign the requests and verify the server responses.

requestUnlockItemsStatus

public static void requestUnlockItemsStatus(android.content.Context context,
                                            java.lang.String userId,
                                            SPUnlockResponseListener listener,
                                            java.lang.String securityToken,
                                            java.lang.String applicationId,
                                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customParams)
Deprecated. This method will be removed from a future release of the SDK.

Requests the status of the "Unlockable" Items to the SponsorPay servers and registers a listener which will be notified when a response is received.

Will use the provided publisher application id instead of trying to retrieve it from the application manifest.

Parameters:
context - Android application context.
userId - The ID of the user for whom the banner will be requested.
listener - SPUnlockResponseListener which will be notified of the results of the request.
securityToken - Security Token associated with the provided Application ID. It's used to sign the requests and verify the server responses.
applicationId - Your Application ID, or null to retrieve it from your application manifest.
customParams - A map of extra key/value pairs to add to the request URL.

requestOfferBanner

public static OfferBannerRequest requestOfferBanner(android.content.Context context,
                                                    java.lang.String userId,
                                                    SPOfferBannerListener listener,
                                                    OfferBanner.AdShape offerBannerAdShape,
                                                    java.lang.String currencyName,
                                                    java.lang.String applicationId)
Deprecated. This method will be removed from a future release of the SDK.

Requests an Offer Banner to the SponsorPay servers and registers a listener which will be notified when a response is received.

Parameters:
context - Android application context.
userId - The ID of the user for whom the banner will be requested.
listener - SPOfferBannerListener which will be notified of the results of the request.
offerBannerAdShape - Provide null for this parameter to request a banner of the default dimensions (320 x 50).
currencyName - The name of the currency employed by your application. Provide null if you don't use a custom currency name.
applicationId - Your Application ID, or null to retrieve it from your application manifest.
Returns:
An OfferBannerRequest instance which manages the request to the server on the background.
